 Daniel Jackson and his many languages.

What gets me about SG1 is Daniels ability to translate all these languages they come across within 5 mins(I know it doesn't happen all the time, but it seems like it). I remember in an episode, but I can't remember which one, the To'kra(is that the correct spelling?) were stuck on a language but Danny Boy solved it in 3 seconds flat. Now is it just me or would the To'kra with their symbiotes and their greater techniological ability be able to solve this linguistical conundrum and not need the likes of Daniel.
Anyway he's not my favourite Daniel, that would be R. Daneel Olivaw. I know it's not Daniel but close enough.

That's what makes the character of Daniel jackson so unique. He really is a skilled linguist. Remember that in the movie Gary Meyers had Translated a piece of of the coverstones found at Giza. Basically Meyers cross referenced many other linguists works including budge who was proclaimed by Daniel to be a bit of a lousy linguist. Anyway, Gary meyers took considerable time, maybe 2 weeks, maybe two years to translate the coverstones hieroglyphics. Then Daniel came along and straight away took a look at the translation and could tell that it was all wrong. In the matter of minutes he had corrected it. Catherine Langford was amazed at this feat. He is just a really good linguist.

I think that the reason Daniel knows so many languages is the fact that the poor guy had no life befor the Stargate program. So he had nothing to do but study and learn other languages. Then he met Sha're.

Locutus

Registered: Oct 2001
Location: Delta Quadrant
Posts: 38

The same thing is happening with Star Trek: Enterprise at the moment.

Hoshi (or however you spell her name) started miraculously conversing with an alien species that even the new fangled translator system couldn't communicate properly with, and that they'd only just met.

At least Danny's is a bit more plausible, because many earth languages share common words, or words that are close in spelling and meaning, and share some common history in some instances. And the off-world people they meet have usually come from earth.

I think we're just supposed to think Danny has a special knack for languages and not question it too much. If we question it too much then the writers might do something silly like have the SGC develop a translator device... While still using MP5's and P90's to fight the Goa'uld.
